commitResults.messageTitle: Add greet message, echo command and exit message
Add ability to store text by user and display them
Add the ability to mark tasks as done
Add support for tracking three types of tasks
Add semi-automated testing of Duke
Teach Duke to deal with errors
Add support for deleting tasks from the list
Save the tasks in the hard disk automatically
commitResults.messageBody:
The tasks are only temporarily used during one execution of the program.

The program needs to be more reusable so that it can actually keep
track of all the tasks that have been made so far in the lifespan of
the program.

A storage for the list of tasks can be implemented to make the program
more reusable.

commitResults.messageTitle: Teach Duke how to understand dates and times
commitResults.messageBody:
Dates entered are displayed as is.

The program should be able to display the dates in a more meaningful
way.

A way to understand different date formats can be implemented to make
the timings of the tasks more understandable.

commitResults.messageTitle: Introduce more OOP design to the program
commitResults.messageBody:
The program tries to do everything in a few classes, particularly the
Duke class.

It is harder to modify the code as it all happens in one class.

Adding new classes will make modifying the code in the future easier.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests to test the behavior of the code
commitResults.messageBody:
The code is presumably workable.

It is difficult to see corner cases that have not been accounted for.

Tests can help to reduce bugs in the code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc comments to the code
commitResults.messageBody:
Some of the public methods are documented for readability.

Some methods are not documented.

Documentation of methods can allow other developers to understand the
code better.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak the code to comply with a coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
Code has some documentation.

 Code could use slight improvement.

 Tweaking the code could comply with the standard better.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc comments to the code
commitResults.messageBody:
Code has some documentation

Some methods require further clarification.

More comments can help.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak the code to comply with a coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
Code has some compliance.

Some import statements could be organized better

More changes can help.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change packages organization
Change organization of directories
Close scanner after use
Add find task functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Program does not support find tasks by keyword

This makes finding tasks troublesome when the list becomes too big.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use checkStyle to detect coding style violations
commitResults.messageBody:
Code generally compiles well.

There are potential code violations according to the standard.

Using checkStyle can correct the violations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add a GUI to Duke
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, Duke can only be interacted with through the CLI.

This is not very practical and is not very user-friendly.

A GUI is easier to interact with.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add changes to style
commitResults.messageBody:
Code compiles fine.

Some parts of the code can be improved.

Some changes to style can be helpful.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add some changes to code style
Add header comments to methods
Change code style
Add Command abstractions
commitResults.messageBody:
Parser currently does all of the work to interact with the logger and
tasklist.

In the long term, if there were new commands, the switch statement would
have to be very long. If there were specific changes to commands, it
would be difficult to edit.

Abstraction of the commands into different classes can allow for more
manageable code in the long term.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add header comments to Command classes
